content:
A generic notebook is a great way to start, and you can always add or modify sections as you see fit.

And yay! I'm so glad you mentioned "The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo"! That book is a masterpiece, isn't it? Taylor Jenkins Reid has a way of crafting stories that are both entertaining and emotionally resonant.

February 10th, huh? You know, it's great that you're keeping track of your reading dates. You can add that to your notebook, along with your thoughts, feelings, and reflections on the book. It'll be wonderful to look back on your reading journey and see how your tastes and perspectives have evolved over time.

What did you think of Evelyn's story, by the way? Did you have a favorite husband or a favorite part of the book?

(And, if you don't mind me asking, how did you find the Notes app on your phone as a temporary solution? Was it helpful, or are you looking forward to having a physical journal?)
